column8: Notes

column1: Hard Boiled Wonderland and the End of the World
column8: The concept of Mind and Memories

column1: Love in the Time of Cholera

column8: the idea of creating a dream world which interacts concurrently with our own, which then runs alongside another dream world. We can thus create and guide and realities...in the end how much control do we really have over them? Are we in the end victim to the one original reality?

column1: South of the Border, West of the Sun

column8: how do we choose morality, is it based on something a priori or due circumstance guide our desicions. Also a lot of rants on one's own perspectibility of others
whoa...comic relief and not much else
Worst of the set of 4, a book that could that had some good devices going but chose to abandon them and jump around, also a disappointment meaningless ending
a subtle graceful story, with character development shown through actions, really good
a tight story that deals with perspective

column1: An Episode in the Life of a Landscape Painter

column11: "shadows of memory rose up in his mind the gold and blood red of countless sunsets accumulated in the indefatigable lushness of the garden, in the indecisive memory of shadows" p 120

column1: The Brief Wondrous Life of Oscar Wao
column8: generational story with unique crass narrator...hope in the face of injustice
column11: The man without a face, Fuku

column8: this book is described as a novel version of a haiku in that it

column1: The Narrative of Arthur Gordon Pym of Nantucket
column8: Whoa...bad book, racist and outdated...direct influence on savage detectves is pretty evident...in the last journal entries of each book...maybe the sheet too
an inlaid set of 6 stories that rise and fall, also how the theme...rise and fall along with how people destroy people, groups destroy groups and civilization destrorys civilization

jumps back and forth from the past to the present analysing how events in our lives guide or fates...page 233...note that this is a lighter version of your face tomorrow, which talks of the same fate but views a sort of uncontrollable fate as having influence in addition to our decisions...whereas your face sought to discuss why we make those desicions.

page 52...mirror analogy...arturo would not look in the mirror as he had not one sending him soap etc, only when he realized there was hope of being released did he look and he did nott recognnize himself (detectives)
fables based on pure scientific theory...masterfully humanizes science in a relateable way

honest and raw stories that are told in a unique and flexible manner. At times they are confusing but they portrary the culture and values of the haida really well. The unpolished effect creates the feel of oral tradition

column1: Miss Lonelyhearts & The Day of the Locust

column8: a look at how someone gets lost in patriotic zeal...uses beautiful short and long metaphors, the protagonist Isao borders on fantantical and unrealistic, also does not dwelve deep enough aside from a 3 page monlouge at the end on his motivations...again a little too all knowing which is often my critique of his stories...but quite beautiful+captivating story

the weakest mishima thus far...his metaphors are forced and the book takes meandering breaks from the tetraology's purpose...honda's overall character changes drastically and unrealistically while other characters purposes for being introduced are thinly veiled as plot drivers
What is love, musings of all sorts
A fantasy novel so to speak the deals with gender, time and the passing of eras and legs

a character rich story that analyzes how we react to war and how hatred can guide our decisions, but then also it ties up nicely with whodunnit like ending as justice prevails...beautiful with rich natural elements if a little corney and too tight
an amazing collections of musings on music and literature...a sharp honest assessment of the value of the arts
the aimless seemly drug induced ramblings and amblings of two characters...modernist in some sense but also post modern in some of his techniques...notably lists and chapter rundowns
toned down techniques compared to bonsai, use of an excellent semi omnipresent narrator which changes the scope and view of the story for a complex arrangment, desivingly so
a story protesting the power issues of an assistant and his boss...beautifully told in a descriptive and lyrical manner
A book on faith that is all over the place, in the end I take the descipitons of the puget sound as very valuable

column1: I Curse the River of Time

column8: a book ahead of its times conceptially...poor writing and story design though
non fiction account of mesculine use...good thoughts on the use of drugs in religious and intellectual life and the expanding of our our perception, interesting dated book
A honest and moving picture of adolencence in the 1950's...honest and genuine while not being over the top
a cute genuine story

column1: What We Talk About When We Talk About Love

column8: a funny book...seems to constrain on the setting more than the relations of the characters and the themes...mostly satire on america today as well as mortality...not subltly though

A crushingly beautiful and poignant story of the power of secrets...full of digressions that link together wonderfully...I don't believe in things whose time has passed, it's all there waiting for us to call it back 227

column1: The Lone Ranger and Tonto Fist Fight in Heavan
column8: Brutally honest and at times beautiful

column1: Bad Nature Or with Elvis in Mexico
column8: A conscise yet effective novella...talks of the power of language and who in fact takes the blame

a story from the point of view of a 13 year old, one of the best I have read from this voice, although not my favourite genre...it is real, geniune and spot on with a little bit of mystery as is childhood

column1: The Love of a Good Women

column8: a little off, I thikn the translation was weak, the tone and voice suffered, a nice enough story, just a little empty

column1: My First Summer in the Sierras

column8: a beautiful last line and an all round pretty view on kenya, in some ways date, yet forgivable
a clear view of the follies and extent and purpose of survial/adventure
